entry.title: Highly active volcano erupts on Reunion amid media frenzy
entry.summary:
Lava erupts from the Piton de la Fournaise "Peak of the Furnace" volcano, on the southeastern corner of the Indian Ocean island of Reunion Saturday, Aug. 1, 2015.

The volcano is in the Reunion National Park - a world heritage site.

entry.title: â€‹Ancient volcano tattooed the Earth with giant rings
entry.summary:
Tectonic activity, or the movement of continental plates, eventually drifted the volcano away from its hot spot, so Pilanesberg is now dormant, according to NASA Earth Observatory.

The Ossipee ring dike formed around 90 million years ago, during the second of three major eruptions throughout the active period of the volcano that created the structure.

entry.title: Volcano-like underground fire is put out after a month
Volcano-like underground fire is put out after a month
Volcano could delay Bali flights again
entry.summary: Stephanie Bond, from the Volcanic Ash Advisory Centre, says light variable winds around the volcano, which lies about 150km west of Bali's Denpasar airport, are unpredictable.

entry.title: The Mirage volcano in Las Vegas to erupt less frequently
entry.summary: After becoming the owner of The Mirage, MGM spent $25 million in 2008 upgrading the volcano with more fire choreographed to a pounding drum-beat soundtrack.

entry.title: The Mirage volcano in Las Vegas to erupt less frequently
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Dec. 8, 2008 file photo, the Mirage Volcano erupts at the Mirage hotel and casino in Las Vegas.

LAS VEGAS (AP) - The Mirage volcano on the Las Vegas Strip is erupting less frequently, but not for any geological reason.

The man-made volcano that has been spewing fire and water since the hotel's 1989 opening, a first-of-its-kind attraction, will now offer two to three nightly shows as the Strip's topography continues to evolve.

Before Monday, the volcano erupted every half-hour beginning at about dusk until midnight, wind permitting.

entry.title: Up close: Vanuatu volcano puts on a glittering, primal show
entry.summary:
At just 361 meters (1,184 feet) elevation, the volcano on the Pacific archipelago of Vanuatu is particularly accessible, and spectacularly active.

Some have dubbed it the world's friendliest volcano, although its primal ferocity and occasionally dangerous eruptions of lava and gas would seem to defy that description.

Legend has it that the volcano is a god.

"It's quite rare to get such a kind of activity in a volcano," he said.

entry.title: Up close: Vanuatu volcano puts on a glittering, primal show
entry.summary: "But people have to be very careful when they walk up the volcano," he said.

entry.title: Colima Volcano Still Spewing Ash in Mexico
entry.summary: Ash and cinders spewed Saturday from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico, prompting authorities to close the airport in the state capital of Colima and order the evacuation of a half dozen hamlets on the flanks of the peak.

entry.title: 70 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: Clouds of ash fill the sky after an eruption by the Colima volcano, known as the Volcano of Fire, near the town of Comala, Mexico, Friday, July 10, 2015.

entry.title: 19 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: The volcano began erupting on Thursday and has become increasingly active, leading officials to relocate people from the community of Yerbabuena in the municipality of Comala.

entry.title: Ash and cinders prompt evacuation of village near Colima volcano in western Mexico
entry.summary:
MEXICO CITY - Ash and cinders spewing from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico have prompted authorities to evacuate 19 people from a nearby village.

The Colima Volcano, which sits near the border of the western states of Colima and Jalisco, is also known as the Volcano of Fire.
